sentence1: Once upon a time there was a scholar, who wandered away from his home and went to Emmet village.
sentence2: So the scholar hired it.

sentence1: So the scholar hired it.
sentence2: One evening he was sitting over his books, when several hundred knights suddenly came galloping into the room.

sentence1: One evening he was sitting over his books, when several hundred knights suddenly came galloping into the room.
sentence2: They had hunting falcons and dogs about as large as gnats and fleas.

sentence1: They had hunting falcons and dogs about as large as gnats and fleas.
sentence2: They came to his bed in the corner of the room, and there they held a great hunt, with bows and arrows: one could see it all quite plainly.

sentence1: They came to his bed in the corner of the room, and there they held a great hunt, with bows and arrows: one could see it all quite plainly.
sentence2: They caught a tremendous quantity of birds and game, and all this game was no larger than little grains of rice.

sentence1: They caught a tremendous quantity of birds and game, and all this game was no larger than little grains of rice.
sentence2: They wore swords at their side and bore spears in their hands, and came to a halt in the north-west corner of the room.

sentence1: They wore swords at their side and bore spears in their hands, and came to a halt in the north-west corner of the room.
sentence2: They were followed by several hundred serving-men.

sentence1: They were followed by several hundred serving-men.
sentence2: These brought with them curtains and covers, tents and tent-poles, pots and kettles, cups and plates, tables and chairs.

sentence1: These brought with them curtains and covers, tents and tent-poles, pots and kettles, cups and plates, tables and chairs.
sentence2: The scholar gradually accustomed himself to the sight.

sentence1: The scholar gradually accustomed himself to the sight.
sentence2: Although the men were so very small he could distinguish everything quite clearly.

sentence1: Although the men were so very small he could distinguish everything quite clearly.
sentence2: He was surrounded by an escort of several thousands.

sentence1: He was surrounded by an escort of several thousands.
sentence2: Before him went runners with whips and rods to clear the way.

sentence1: Before him went runners with whips and rods to clear the way.
sentence2: Whereupon the one who wore the scarlet hat got down from his horse, and, followed by a retinue of several hundred men, approached the saucer which the scholar used for his writing-ink.

sentence1: Whereupon the one who wore the scarlet hat got down from his horse, and, followed by a retinue of several hundred men, approached the saucer which the scholar used for his writing-ink.
sentence2: Musicians and dancers stood ready.

sentence1: Musicians and dancers stood ready.
sentence2: Pipes and flutes, fiddles and cymbals sounded, and the dancers moved in the dance.

sentence1: Pipes and flutes, fiddles and cymbals sounded, and the dancers moved in the dance.
sentence2: After three courses, he who wore the scarlet hat said: "Quick!

sentence1: After three courses, he who wore the scarlet hat said: "Quick!
sentence2: And at once nets were thrown out into the saucer which held the water in which the scholar dipped his brush.

sentence1: And at once nets were thrown out into the saucer which held the water in which the scholar dipped his brush.
sentence2: The one with the scarlet hat contented himself with casting a line in the shallow waters of the saucer, and caught a baker's dozen of red carp.

sentence1: The one with the scarlet hat contented himself with casting a line in the shallow waters of the saucer, and caught a baker's dozen of red carp.
sentence2: Then he ordered the head cook to cook the fish, and the most varied dishes were prepared with them.

sentence1: Then he ordered the head cook to cook the fish, and the most varied dishes were prepared with them.
sentence2: And then the wearer of the scarlet hat in his arrogance, decided to amuse himself at the scholar's expense.

sentence1: And then the wearer of the scarlet hat in his arrogance, decided to amuse himself at the scholar's expense.
sentence2: So he pointed to him and said: "I know nothing at all about the writings and customs of the saints and wise men, and still I am a king who is highly honored!

sentence1: So he pointed to him and said: "I know nothing at all about the writings and customs of the saints and wise men, and still I am a king who is highly honored!
sentence2: Yonder scholar spends his whole life toiling over his books and yet he remains poor and gets nowhere.

sentence1: Yonder scholar spends his whole life toiling over his books and yet he remains poor and gets nowhere.
sentence2: If he could make up his mind to serve me faithfully as one of my officials, I might allow him to partake of our meal."

sentence1: If he could make up his mind to serve me faithfully as one of my officials, I might allow him to partake of our meal."
sentence2: This angered the scholar, and he took his book and struck at them.

sentence1: This angered the scholar, and he took his book and struck at them.
sentence2: He followed them and dug up the earth in the place where they had disappeared.

sentence1: He followed them and dug up the earth in the place where they had disappeared.
sentence2: And there he found an ants' nest as large as a barrel, in which countless green ants were wriggling around.

sentence1: And there he found an ants' nest as large as a barrel, in which countless green ants were wriggling around.
sentence2: So he built a large fire and smoked them out.
